title: Installation issue: r-rjava
body:
Dear all

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install jdk@11.0.1 %gcc@7.3.0
$ spack install r %gcc@7.3.0 ^python@3.6.5 

--> These two installations work fine. Then:

$ spack install r-rjava %gcc@7.3.0 ^pyhton@3.6.5

==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/r-3.5.1-di66niep/bin/R' 'CMD' 'INSTALL' '--library=/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/r-rjava-0.9-8-yu55wod6/rlib/R/library' '/local/swadm/spack/var/spack/stage/r-rjava-0.9-8-yu55wod6vqkvpkkx33ucktpmfcdtbqbx/rJava'

1 error found in build log:
     275    interpreter : '/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/bin/java'
     276    archiver    : '/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/bin/jar'
     277    compiler    : '/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/bin/javac'
     278    header prep.: ''
     279    cpp flags   : '-I/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/include -I/cfs/software/sp
            ack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/include/linux'
     280    java libs   : '-L/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/jdk-11.0.1-xb3jf5ne/lib/server -ljvm'
  >> 281    configure: error: One or more Java configuration variables are not set.
     282    Make sure R is configured with full Java support (including JDK). Run
     283    R CMD javareconf
     284    as root to add Java support to R.
     285    
     286    If you don't have root privileges, run
     287    R CMD javareconf -e
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux build02.hpc.zhaw.ch 3.10.0-862.14.4.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 26 15:12:11 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	CentOS Linux release 7.5.1804 (Core)
``` 
and, if relevant, post or attach:

- `packages.yaml`
- `compilers.yaml`

to the issue

### Additional information

Sometimes the issue benefits from additional details. In these cases there are
a few things we can suggest doing. First of all, you can post the full output of:
